alert.note: Alert for Escambia; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 7:24AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Baldwin. portions of northwest Florida, including the following counties, Escambia and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated numerous showers and thunderstorms developing over the advisory area. Some of these storms are producing rainfall amounts between one and two inches per hour. These torrential downpours are falling over locations that have been saturated from heavy rainfall the past few days. Excessive runoff from heavy rains will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pensacola, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Warrington, Gulf Shores, Foley, Gulf Breeze, Orange Beach, Goulding, Lillian, Myrtle Grove, Oriole Beach, Bon Secour, Perdido Beach, Elberta, Millview, Pleasant Grove and Beach Haven. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
